about_the_game:
Project Glasloc is a co-operative horror game playable for up to 5 surv- VOLUNTEERS! That's you!
After the discovery of a few pseudo-real creatures, a project was created to find out their origins and stop them from leaking into reality.
Unfortunately due to the moral issues of the project lead, Dr Glasloc, creatures of a psuedo-real origin are making their way into reality somehow and it's up to the kind volunteers to find out how.


Kindly volunteer your service to our great organization, the iaofmnaig, for the rest of your short life! When you inevitably do, your job will be to enter a designated area, likely an old facility and do exactly as your told. Don't worry about the turnover rates, you'll be fine I'm sure!


  • Securing Lab Samples
  • Recovering Black Box footage
  • Recording Pseudo-Real events
  • nOtHiNg Is As It SeEmS
  • Surviving to serve another day!

Feel like you're not doing enough to serve? Fret not! There will be more duties in due time!

content_descriptors.notes: Being a co-operative horror game, players will likely witness other players or themselves be killed by the creatures in this game. There will be blood and body parts left over after such a scene as well as blood and body parts being used for props.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i5-9600k
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 10 series GPU should be fine.
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 3 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i5-9600k
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 10 series GPU should be fine.
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 3 GB available space

short_description: Project Glasloc is a co-operative horror game playable for up to 5 Volunteers. Work together to survive dives into old facilities trying to acquire and upload important data for our glorious organization. Nothing could possibly go wrong and don't worry about the employee turn-over rates.
